cab.content: dCWFIDENTIAL LIBRA[This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty^ Government.])A)).,-..-jj Printed for the Cabinet. November 1925. kJUCONFIDENTIAL.[C 13656/459/18]MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR FOREIGNAFFAIRS.Locarno Conference.THERE are on record in the Foreign Office: 1. The British Secretary's notes of the meetings of the conference ;2. The British Secretary's notes of two meetings between the Heads of theBritish, French and German delegations ; 3. Records of conversations between the Heads of various delegations and myself;4. Records of conversations between other members of the British delegation and foreign delegates; 5. Telegraphic reports and explanatory despatches ;6. The final protocol of the conference, together with the various instruments initialled at Locarno.Of these, Nos. 5 and 6 have been already circulated to the Cabinet. I believe that these papers contain all that my colleagues will wish to see, but copies of the remaining documents will be placed at the disposal of any Minister who wishes to study them if he will be good enough to call at the Foreign Office.(Initialled) A. C.November 4, 1925.3131 [13781].
